Class Tree<T>

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.utils.beans.Tree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of element in the tree.
public class Tree<T>
extends java.lang.Object

Since java.util still does not have a Tree implementation, here is one.

getChildNodeOf

public Tree<T> getChildNodeOf(T t)
Gets the first child node of this tree that has the specified object as its root element. Only the direct children of this tree are searched. Their children are ignored.

Parameters:
t - Object being searched.
Returns:
Returns the first direct child node of this tree that has the specified element as root. If there is no direct child node of this tree with the specified root element, then returns null;

getAnyNodeOf

public Tree<T> getAnyNodeOf(T t)
Gets the first child node of this tree that has the specified object as its root element. Only the direct children of this tree are searched. Their children are ignored.

Parameters:
t - Object being searched.
Returns:
Returns the first direct child node of this tree that has the specified element as root. If there is no direct child node of this tree with the specified root element, then returns null;
